summary: Email chain between a federal prosecutor and attorneys for TD Bank regarding a grand jury subpoena for bank accounts related to Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence discusses the process for closing certain accounts, holding others open for the investigation, and planning to subpoena additional TD accounts.

persons.name: Nicolas Bourtin
persons.context: Communicates with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding the process for closing and holding open bank accounts related to the Epstein investigation in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Gillian P. Seaman
persons.context: Corresponds with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding the grand jury subpoena to TD Bank, sending a letter and a password-protected hard drive containing data.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Authorized signer for JSC Interiors LLC account
persons.context: Identified as the authorized signer for a TD Bank account in the name of 'JSC Interiors LLC' that is part of the Epstein-related financial investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation referenced in the grand jury subpoena and correspondence is related to him, focusing on his financial accounts at TD Bank.

connections.description: Both are attorneys corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding the TD Bank subpoena; Seaman is copied on Bourtin's emails.
Kahn is the authorized signer for a company account ('JSC Interiors LLC') that is part of the Epstein-related financial investigation.
Bourtin, representing TD Bank, is in direct communication with the AUSA regarding the execution of the grand jury subpoena and account closures.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to TD Bank
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to TD Bank N.A. for records related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.

events.title: Formal Request to Keep Accounts Open
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's office sent a formal letter requesting that certain TD Bank accounts related to the investigation be kept open for one more month.

events.title: Permission to Close Accounts
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's office confirmed that TD Bank could close the accounts referenced in the prior hold-open letter, as they were no longer needed to be kept open.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Sullivan & Cromwell LLP, 125 Broad Street, New York, NY 10004-2498
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's finances via a grand jury subpoena to TD Bank in October 2019.
The investigation involved multiple accounts, including eight under 'HBRK Associates' and one for 'JSC Interiors LLC' with Richard Kahn as the authorized signer.
Prosecutors initially requested TD Bank hold certain accounts open for the investigation but later authorized their closure in November 2019.
The correspondence indicates plans to subpoena additional TD Bank accounts related to Epstein as part of the ongoing investigation.
